intro: Gelseminum pandorea, commonly known as the sweet scent vine, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It is a climbing vine that produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange. The plant belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many toxic plants. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a smooth texture and a slightly waxy appearance. The flowers emit a sweet fragrance, attracting pollinators such as butterflies and hummingbirds.
